activities.description: Took the red eye from Los Angeles to New York.

activities.location: 50 Central Park S, New York, NY 10019
activities.description: Checked into the Ritz-Carlton New York.

activities.location: 240 Central Park S, New York, NY 10019
activities.description: Ate lunch at Marea which serves a high-end Italian seafood and housemade pastas in a chic Central Park South setting! For my starter, I ordered the Tartare Di Tonno (yellowfin tuna with pear, pomegranate, and quail egg yolk). Then for my main dish, I ordered the Pansotti (a ricotta ravioli, with basil-arugula pesto, topped with pine nuts). Everything was delicious!
I rediscovered the kid in me at the Museum of Ice Cream. It definitely energizes the senses to reimagine the way we experience and love ice cream!

I had dinner at Balthazar, a bustling, romantic brasserie that serves traditional French fare! I started off with the warm goat cheese and caramelized onion tart. I followed that with the grilled chicken paillard. Amazing food!
Took the red eye from Los Angeles to New York.
